titles.title: Commuter Act of 2009
Creating Opportunities to Motivate Mass-transit Utilization To Encourage Ridership Act of 2009
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow employers a refundable credit against income tax for 50 percent of the employer's cost of providing tax-free transit passes to employees.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E15)
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary:
1/6/2009--Introduced.
Creating Opportunities to Motivate Mass-transit Utilization to Encourage Ridership Act of 2009 or the Commuter Act of 2009 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow employers a refundable tax credit for 50% of the cost of transit passes provided on a tax-free basis to employees.
